channel.title: Is hamachi less laggy than no-ip

item.title: Is hamachi less laggy than no-ip
item.dc:creator: @superstuntguy superstuntguy
item.description:
@superstuntguy wrote:

Hamachi is absolutely a lot more laggy than no-ip!
Because, with hamachi, you are adding a slow extra step.

No-ip is not special, there is no difference from plazapkscape.no-ip.info and 71.252.241.119. (Both me)
If you have a dynamic ip, meaning it changes every so often, then would you like telling people a different ip every once in a while?
E.g., would you like telling people that your server was 71.252.241.*** a week ago, but know its a 71.252.241.***?
Thats where no-ip comes in, it just points you at that ip, no difference.

Hamachi however, makes that a whole lot more complicated process.
First, you tell your client to connect to a hamachi ip, hamachi takes your request, sends it thru hamachi’s servers, which send it to the hamachi server, which finally gets given to the server.
That may not seem so bad, but then put a high strength encryption on it!
This slows things up a lot!

So, hamachi is slower.

Edit: If you think that i’m stupid to give out my ip address, then remember, you just need to do a whois on ANY .no-ip. and you’ll get the ip address of that person.
And I have port scanning traps set into my firewall

Read full topic
item.source: Is hamachi less laggy than no-ip
